alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Lowndes; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Autauga, northeastern Lowndes and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Autauga County Airport, or 8 miles southwest of Prattville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Montgomery, Prattville, Autaugaville, Hunter, Dannelly Field, Autauga County Airport and Manack. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
